content: 1 double_crochet 5 in round 3 mc chain 2 double_crochet 1 in first double_crochet see picture round 3 1 * double_crochet 1 treble_crochet 1 double_crochet 1 in next treble_crochet double_crochet 4 make sure your one-third hexagons have the same number of row as the half hexagons repeat from * 5 times then double_crochet 1 treble_crochet 1 double_crochet 1 in next treble_crochet double_crochet 3 42 sts circles join the round with a slip_stitch into the first st round 1 magic_ring round 4 chain 2 does not count as chain 2 double_crochet 2 * double_crochet 1 treble_crochet 1 double_crochet 1 in next treble_crochet double_crochet 6 repeat from a st here and in the rest * 5 times double_crochet 1 treble_crochet 1 double_crochet 1 in next treble_crochet double_crochet 4 54 sts of the pattern double_crochet 12 in ring join with a slip_stitch into all next rounds first st 12 sts work a double_crochet 1 treble_crochet 1 double_crochet 1 corner in each treble_crochet from the previous round round 2 for the sides double_crochet in each double_crochet from the previous round chain 2 and turn double_crochet into the first stitch then 2 double_crochet continue working in rounds until the hexagon reaches in each stitch from the desired dimensions previous round slip_stitch half hexagons repeat round 2 as needed pattern by raffamusa designs see link for photo instructions on each of the circles surface crochet the following numbers row 1 ● 1 of each make a mc chain 2 does not count as a st here and ○ 2 12 throughout double_crochet 7 in mc 7 sts ● 2 of each ○ 3 4 5 6 8 9 10 11 row 2 chain 2 and turn double_crochet 1 in first st double_crochet 1 treble_crochet 1 double_crochet 1 in next st roads double_crochet increase 1 twice double_crochet 1 treble_crochet 1 double_crochet 1 in next st double_crochet 1 in last st 12 double_crochet 3 treble_crochet row 1 chain 14 turn row 3 chain 2 and turn double_crochet 2 double_crochet 1 treble_crochet 1 double_crochet 1 in next st double_crochet 4 row 2 twice double_crochet 1 treble_crochet 1 double_crochet 1 in next st double_crochet 2 18 double_crochet 3 treble_crochet double_crochet into the 3rd chain from the hook double_crochet 11 continue to the end of the row this results in a nearly flat braided effect settlements connect the resource tiles using tan/beige yarn and the row 1 blue sea tiles with matching blue yarn mc chain 3 counts as first treble_crochet 2dc 1 treble_crochet 2 double_crochet 3 times slip_stitch to join row 2 chain 3 3 double_crochet-cluster in next 3 sts cities row 1 chain 10 turn row 2 double_crochet into the 3rd chain from border the hook double_crochet 7 turn row 3 crochet a double_crochet border around the entire perimeter to neaten chain 3 double_crochet 7 turn the edges row 4 that s it chain 3 3 double_crochet-cluster into next 3 sts i d love to see your finished catan blanket send me a picture over instagram @the_crafty_quince or by
